item.title: annemm add a quote by Arthur Golden
item.description: "This humble person has been alive long enough to see two generations of children grow up, and knows how rare it is for ordinary birds to give birth to a swan. The swan who goes on living in its parents' tree will die; this is why those who are beautiful and talented bear the burden of finding their own way into the world." -- Arthur Golden

item.title: annemm add a quote by Arthur Golden
item.description: "Those of us with water in our personalities don't pick where we'll flow to. All we can do is flow where the landscape of our lives carries us" -- Arthur Golden

item.title: annemm add a quote by Arthur Golden
item.description: "Adversity is like a strong wind. I don't mean just that it holds us back from places we might otherwise go. It also tears away from us all but the things that cannot be torn, so that afterward we see ourselves as we really are, and not merely as we might like to be." -- Arthur Golden

item.title: annemm add a quote by Arthur Golden
item.description: "Sometimes we get through adversity only by imagining what the world might be like if our dreams should ever come true." -- Arthur Golden

item.title: annemm add a quote by Arthur Golden
item.description: "I dont think any of us can speak frankly about pain until we are no longer enduring it." -- Arthur Golden

item.title: annemm add a quote by Arthur Golden
item.description: "Now I know that our world is no more permanent than a wave rising on the ocean. Whatever our struggles and triumphs, however we may suffer them, all too soon they bleed into a wash, just like watery ink on paper." -- Arthur Golden
